TEXT.English: Biologists in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have developed a hardy crop that has increased food production.

TEXT.German: Brutale Landesherren belasten die armen Leibeigenen im %s1_civ_adjective Imperium durch schwere Steuern.

TEXT.Spanish: Brutal landlords have taxed poor serfs heavily in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire.

TEXT.English: Landlords around the city of %s2_city have brutally taxed the local serfs.

TEXT.Italian: Landlords around the city of %s2_city have brutally taxed the local serfs.
TEXT.Spanish: Landlords around the city of %s2_city have brutally taxed the local serfs.

TEXT.English: Their suffering will fuel our treasury.
TEXT.French: Leurs Souffrances vont alimenter notre Trésor.
TEXT.German: Ihr Leiden wird unsere Schatzkammer auffüllen.
TEXT.Italian: Their suffering will fuel our treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: Their suffering will fuel our treasury.

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has discovered significant deposits of salt within their borders.

TEXT.English: The citizens of the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city have built a war memorial to commemorate the lives of soldiers lost in recent wars.

TEXT.Spanish: Our citizens living in %s2_city have built a war memorial to commemerate the lives of our brave soldiers.

TEXT.German: Man wird sich so lange an sie erinnern, wie unser neues Monument steht.
TEXT.Italian: They will be remembered so long as our new monuments stand.
TEXT.Spanish: They will be remembered so long as our new monuments stand.

TEXT.English: The new additions to our monuments will continue to awe the locals.
TEXT.French: Ces ajouts à nos Monuments vont continuer de remplir d'effroi les habitants.
TEXT.German: Die neue Ergänzung unserer Monumente wird die Einheimischen weiter beeindrucken.
TEXT.Italian: The new additions to our monuments will continue to awe the locals.
TEXT.Spanish: The new additions to our monuments will continue to awe the locals.

TEXT.English: Monuments in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city are revered by travelers far and wide for their beauty.
TEXT.French: Les Monuments de la Ville %s1:2_civ_adjective de %s2_city sont vénérés par les voyageurs du monde entier pour leur beauté.
TEXT.German: Monumente in der %s1_civ_adjective Stadt %s2_city werden von Reisenden aus nah und fern für ihre Schönheit bewundert.
TEXT.Italian: Monuments in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city are revered by travelers far and wide for their beauty.
TEXT.Spanish: Monuments in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city are revered by travelers far and wide for their beauty.

TEXT.English: Travelers love the monuments in the city of %s2_city, and the locals are benefiting greatly.
TEXT.French: Les Voyageurs adorent les Monuments de notre Ville de %s2_city, et les riverains en bénéficient grandement.
TEXT.German: Reisende lieben das Monument in %s2_city, die Einheimischen profitieren davon in großem Maße.
TEXT.Italian: Travelers love the monuments in the city of %s2_city, and the locals are benefiting greatly.
TEXT.Spanish: Travelers love the monuments in the city of %s2_city, and the locals are benefiting greatly.

TEXT.English: This will bring prestige to the city!
TEXT.French: Cela va apporter du prestige à la Ville!
TEXT.German: Das wird unserer Stadt viel Prestige bringen!
TEXT.Italian: This will bring prestige to the city!
TEXT.Spanish: This will bring prestige to the city!

TEXT.English: Priests in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have denounced current research projects as heresy.
TEXT.French: Des Prêtres de l'Empire %s1_civ_adjective ont dénoncé comme hérésie des récents projets de recherche.
TEXT.German: Priester im %s1_civ_adjective Imperium haben ein aktuelles Forschungsprojekt als Häresie verurteilt.
TEXT.Italian: Priests in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have denounced current research projects as heresy.
TEXT.Spanish: Priests in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have denounced current research projects as heresy.

TEXT.English: Our priests have declared our current research heretical and have denounced it in public sermons.
TEXT.French: Nos Prêtres ont déclaré nos récents projets de recherche comme une hérésie, et les dénoncent en public lors de leurs Sermons.
TEXT.German: Unsere Priester haben das aktuelle Forschungsprojekt als häretisch bezeichnet und es in öffentlichen Gesängen verurteilt.
TEXT.Italian: Our priests have declared our current research heretical and have denounced it in public sermons.
TEXT.Spanish: Our priests have declared our current research heretical and have denounced it in public sermons.

TEXT.English: We need to take a step back and convince our followers that our research will not conflict with our faith.
TEXT.French: Il nous faut revoir notre position et convaincre nos confrères que ces recherches ne sont pas en conflit avec notre Foi.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen einen Schritt zurückgehen und unsere Anhänger davon überzeugen, dass unsere Forschung keinen Konflikt zu unserem Glauben darstellt.
TEXT.Italian: We need to take a step back and convince our followers that our research will not conflict with our faith.
TEXT.Spanish: We need to take a step back and convince our followers that our research will not conflict with our faith.

TEXT.English: Times change, and so do we. They will get over it eventually.
TEXT.French: Les Temps Changent, et nous avec. Cela va leur passer.
TEXT.German: Die Zeiten ändern sich, so wie wir selbst. Sie werden eines Tages darüber hinwegkommen.
TEXT.Italian: Times change, and so do we. They will get over it eventually.
TEXT.Spanish: Times change, and so do we. They will get over it eventually.

TEXT.English: Efforts in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire to reduce paperwork and personnel in government have been an outrageous success.
TEXT.French: Les Efforts de l'Empire %s1_civ_adjective pour réduire les formalités administratives et le personnel de leur gouvernement ont remporté succès scandaleux.
TEXT.German: Bemühungen im %s1_civ_adjective Imperium, den Papierkrieg und das Personal in der Regierung zu reduzieren wurden zu einem unglaublichen Erfolg.
TEXT.Italian: Efforts in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire to reduce paperwork and personnel in government have been an outrageous success.
TEXT.Spanish: Efforts in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire to reduce paperwork and personnel in government have been an outrageous success.

TEXT.English: Efforts to reduce paperwork and the number of personnel in the government has been successful.
TEXT.French: Nos Efforts pour réduire les formalités administratives et le personnel du gouvernement ont été couronnés de succès.
TEXT.German: Bemühungen den Papierkrieg und das Personal in der Regierung zu reduzieren waren erfolgreich.

TEXT.German: Ausgezeichnet, das wird die Effektivität unserer Verwaltung verbessern.
TEXT.Italian: Excellent, this will improve our administration's efficiency.
TEXT.Spanish: Excellent, this will improve our administration's efficiency.

TEXT.English: Court magistrates in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have falsified treasury records.

TEXT.Italian: Court magistrates in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have falsified treasury records.
TEXT.Spanish: Court magistrates in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have falsified treasury records.

TEXT.French: Des magistrats ont révélés que nos impôts étaient plus qu'optimistes ces dernières années.
TEXT.German: Verwaltungsbeamte haben aufgedeckt, dass die Aufzeichnungen unserer Steuereinnahmen der letzten Jahre deutlich zu optimistisch waren.
TEXT.Italian: Court magistrates have revealed our tax collection records were more than optimistic for the last few years.
TEXT.Spanish: Court magistrates have revealed our tax collection records were more than optimistic for the last few years.

TEXT.English: It looks like our treasury is not as large as we thought.
TEXT.French: On dirait que notre trésor n'est pas aussi important que prévu.
TEXT.German: Es sieht so aus, als wäre der Staatsschatz nicht so groß wie gedacht.
TEXT.Italian: It looks like our treasury is not as large as we thought.
TEXT.Spanish: It looks like our treasury is not as large as we thought.

TEXT.English: A local noble in %s1_civ_adjective Empire who showed promise in the last war has been promoted to Master-of-Arms.
TEXT.French: Un noble local de l'Empire %s1_civ_adjective qui s'est distingué au combat durant la dernière Guerre a été promu Maître d'Armes.

TEXT.Spanish: A local noble in %s1_civ_adjective Empire who showed promise in the last war has been promoted to Master-of-Arms.

TEXT.Italian: A local noble who showed talent as a commander in the last war is also an incredibly efficient administrator in his home province.
TEXT.Spanish: A local noble who showed talent as a commander in the last war is also an incredibly efficient administrator in his home province.

TEXT.English: Appoint him as our new Master-of-Arms.
TEXT.French: Nommez-le comme notre nouveau Maître d'Armes.
TEXT.German: Ernennt ihn zum neuen Waffenmeister.
TEXT.Italian: Appoint him as our new Master-of-Arms.
TEXT.Spanish: Appoint him as our new Master-of-Arms.

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has begun purging their government of suspected traitors. Other world leaders are concerned.
TEXT.French: L'Empire %s1_civ_adjective a commencé a épurer son gouvernement de traîtres supposés. Des Chefs d'Etats étrangers pourraient être impliqués.

TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective Empire has begun purging their government of suspected traitors. Other world leaders are concerned.

TEXT.English: We have begun purging those in our government with questionable loyalties.
TEXT.French: Nous avons commencé à épurer les membres de notre gouvernement dont la loyauté présentait quelques doutes.
TEXT.German: Wir haben damit begonnen, jene in unserer Regierung mit fraglicher Loyalität auszusieben.
TEXT.Italian: We have begun purging those in our government with questionable loyalties.
TEXT.Spanish: We have begun purging those in our government with questionable loyalties.

TEXT.English: Let the fall of these traitors be a sign that better times are coming.
TEXT.French: Puisse la chute de ces traîtres être un signe de prospérité à venir.
TEXT.German: Lass den Untergang von diesen Verrätern ein Zeichen für bessere Zeiten sein.
TEXT.Italian: Let the fall of these traitors be a sign that better times are coming.
TEXT.Spanish: Let the fall of these traitors be a sign that better times are coming.

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective monarch seems more interested in his gardens than in the welfare of his state.
TEXT.French: Le Monarque %s1_civ_adjective paraît plus intéressé par ses jardins que par le bien-être de son Etat.
TEXT.German: Der %s1_civ_adjective Monarch scheint mehr Wert auf seinen Garten als auf das Wohlergehen seines Staates zu legen.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1_civ_adjective monarch seems more interested in his gardens than in the welfare of his state.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective monarch seems more interested in his gardens than in the welfare of his state.

TEXT.English: Our monarch seems more concerned with beautifying his gardens than preserving the royal treasury.
TEXT.French: Notre Monarque semble plus enclin à soigner ses beaux jardins qu'à préserver le trésor royal.
TEXT.German: Unser Monarch scheint sich mehr um die Verschönerung seines Gartens als um den Erhalt des Staatsschatzes zu sorgen.
TEXT.Italian: Our monarch seems more concerned with beautifying his gardens than preserving the royal treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: Our monarch seems more concerned with beautifying his gardens than preserving the royal treasury.

TEXT.English: At least these new additions to the Palace will brighten up the capital.
TEXT.French: Au moins, ces mesures vont égayer le Palais et la Capitale.

TEXT.Spanish: At least these new additions to the Palace will brighten up the capital.

TEXT.English: The academy in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city has received generous funding from wealthy businessmen.

TEXT.German: Die Akademie in der %s1_civ_adjective Stadt %s2_city hat von reichen Geschäftsleuten eine großzügige Unterstützung erhalten.

TEXT.English: This is welcome news.

TEXT.German: Das sind sehr willkommene Neuigkeiten.
TEXT.Italian: This is welcome news.
TEXT.Spanish: This is welcome news.

TEXT.Spanish: The university in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city draws students from across the globe to study ancient poetry, literature, and rhetoric.

TEXT.English: Our university in %s2_city has specialized in the study of ancient poetry, literature, and rhetoric. Students from around the world yearn to study with our experts.
TEXT.French: Notre Université de %s2_city s'est spécialisée dans la poésie, la littérature et la rhétorique. Des Etudiants du Monde Entier accourent pour écouter l'enseignement de nos experts.
TEXT.German: Unsere Universität in in %s2_city hat sich auf das Studium von alter Dichtung, Literatur und Rhetorik spezialisiert. Studenten aus der ganzen Welt sehnen sich danach, mit unseren Experten zu studieren.
TEXT.Italian: Our university in %s2_city has specialized in the study of ancient poetry, literature, and rhetoric. Students from around the world yearn to study with our experts.
TEXT.Spanish: Our university in %s2_city has specialized in the study of ancient poetry, literature, and rhetoric. Students from around the world yearn to study with our experts.

TEXT.English: Although this will not further scientific progress, it will make the people happy.
TEXT.French: Bien que cela ne va engendre aucun réel progrès scientifique, cela a le mérite de rendre le peuple heureux.
TEXT.German: Auch wenn das den wissenschaftlichen Fortschritt nicht voranbringt, so macht es dich die Leute glücklicher.
TEXT.Italian: Although this will not further scientific progress, it will make the people happy.
TEXT.Spanish: Although this will not further scientific progress, it will make the people happy.

TEXT.English: The lack of social advancement in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city has resulted in emigration to foreign lands.
TEXT.French: le manque d'avancées sociales dans la Ville %s1:2_civ_adjective de %s2_city a entraîné une exode de sa population.

TEXT.Spanish: The lack of social advancement in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city has resulted in emigration to foreign lands.

TEXT.English: Subjects in the city of %s2_city are fed up with the lack of social advancement. They are migrating elsewhere for opportunities to better their lives.
TEXT.French: Nos Sujets de %s2_city en ont assez du manque d'avancées sociales dans leur Ville. Ils quittent la Ville à la recherche d'une Vie meilleure ailleurs.
TEXT.German: Bewohner der Stadt %s2_city haben genug vom Mangel an sozialem Fortschritt. Sie ziehen fort um anderswo nach einem besseren Leben zu suchen.

TEXT.Spanish: Subjects in the city of %s2_city are fed up with the lack of social advancement. They are migrating elsewhere for opportunities to better their lives.

TEXT.English: Good riddance. People should know their place.
TEXT.French: Bon débarras. Le Peuple doit connaître sa place.
TEXT.German: Schön sie los zu werden. Die Leute sollten wissen, wo sie hingehören.
TEXT.Italian: Good riddance. People should know their place.
TEXT.Spanish: Good riddance. People should know their place.

TEXT.English: The %s1_civ_adjective economy is suffering from a severe recession. Economists are arguing over whether government spending should be increased to compensate.
TEXT.French: L'économie %s1:2_civ_adjective connaît une crise sans précédent. Les économistes se disputent pour savoir si les dépenses gouvernementales doivent être augmentées pour la relancer.
TEXT.German: Die %s1_civ_adjective Wirtschaft leidet unter einer schweren Rezession. Die Wirtschaftsexperten streiten sich darüber, ob die Staatsausgaben zum Ausgleich erhöht werden sollen.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1_civ_adjective economy is suffering from a severe recession. Economists are arguing over whether government spending should be increased to compensate.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1_civ_adjective economy is suffering from a severe recession. Economists are arguing over whether government spending should be increased to compensate.

TEXT.English: Our economy has taken a sudden and serious downturn and no relief is in sight. Economists are arguing over whether government spending should be increased.
TEXT.French: Notre économie a subi un sacré revers et il n'y a pas de signes encourageants pour les prochains temps. Les économistes se disputent pour savoir si les dépenses gouvernementales doivent être augmentées pour la relancer.
TEXT.German: Unsere Wirtschaft ist unerwartet stark zurückgegangen und es ist keine Besserung in Sicht. Die Wirtschaftsexperten streiten sich darüber, ob die Staatsausgaben erhöht werden sollen.
TEXT.Italian: Our economy has taken a sudden and serious downturn and no relief is in sight. Economists are arguing over whether government spending should be increased.
TEXT.Spanish: Our economy has taken a sudden and serious downturn and no relief is in sight. Economists are arguing over whether government spending should be increased.

TEXT.English: Stick to our guns...the government should not interfere in the markets.
TEXT.French: "Ranges vos armes..." Le gouvernement ne doit pas interférer dans les marchés.
TEXT.German: Schuster bleib bei deinen Leisten...die Regierung sollte sich nicht in die Marktangelegenheiten einmischen.
TEXT.Italian: Stick to our guns...the government should not interfere in the markets.
TEXT.Spanish: Stick to our guns...the government should not interfere in the markets.

TEXT.English: Listen to these whiny "economists" and try to offset the decline in consumer spending with our treasury.
TEXT.French: Ecoutons-les et essayons de contre-balancer cette baisse de consommation avec notre trésor.
TEXT.German: Hört auf die weinerlichen "Wirtschaftsexperten" und versucht den Rückgang an privater Nachfrage durch Ausgaben aus unser Schatzkammer auszugleichen.
TEXT.Italian: Listen to these whiny "economists" and try to offset the decline in consumer spending with our treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: Listen to these whiny "economists" and try to offset the decline in consumer spending with our treasury.

TEXT.English: Sheep in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have produced unusually high quality wool. Profits from coat sales are up.
TEXT.French: Les Moutons de l'Empire %s1_civ_adjective ont produit une laine d'une qualité particulièrement bonne. Les profits provenant des ventes de vêtements sont en hausse.
TEXT.German: Schafe im %s1_civ_adjective Imperium haben eine Wolle von außergewöhnlich hoher Qualität produziert. Die Profite vom Verkauf von Wintermänteln steigen.
TEXT.Italian: Sheep in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have produced unusually high quality wool. Profits from coat sales are up.
TEXT.Spanish: Sheep in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire have produced unusually high quality wool. Profits from coat sales are up.

TEXT.English: The wool produced from this pasture is of very high quality this year.
TEXT.French: La Laine produite par les moutons de nos pâtures est de très bonne qualité cette année.

TEXT.English: Elders in %s1_civ_adjective society are disappointed in the music and culture of today's youth.

TEXT.English: Flour produced by these mills has been featured in many cake recipes in a now-famous cookbook. Sales are booming.
TEXT.French: La Farine de ces moulins est l'ingrédient de base de recettes fabuleuses compilées dans un livre 'bestSeller'. Leur vente explose.
TEXT.German: Mehl von diesen Mühlen wird in vielen Kuchenrezepten eines sehr berühmten Kochbuches verwendet. Die Verkäufe laufen hervorragend.
TEXT.Italian: Flour produced by these mills has been featured in many cake recipes in a now-famous cookbook. Sales are booming.
TEXT.Spanish: Flour produced by these mills has been featured in many cake recipes in a now-famous cookbook. Sales are booming.

TEXT.English: My favorite is on page 42.
TEXT.French: Ma préférée est page 42.
TEXT.German: Mein Favorit steht auf Seite 42.
TEXT.Italian: My favorite is on page 42.
TEXT.Spanish: My favorite is on page 42.

TEXT.English: A local species of silkworm in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire is almost extinct.
TEXT.French: Une espèce locale de vers à soie de l'Empire %s1_civ_adjective Empire est presque éteinte.
TEXT.German: Eine regionale Spezies von Seidenwürmern im %s1_civ_adjective Imperium ist nahezu ausgestorben.
TEXT.Italian: A local species of silkworm in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire is almost extinct.
TEXT.Spanish: A local species of silkworm in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire is almost extinct.

TEXT.English: A local species of silkworm has nearly gone extinct. There is still time to save them.
TEXT.French: Une espèce local de vers à soie a presque disparu de notre région. Il est encore temps de les sauver.
TEXT.German: Eine regionale Spezies von Seidenwürmern ist nahezu ausgestorben. Noch ist Zeit, sie zu retten.
TEXT.Italian: A local species of silkworm has nearly gone extinct. There is still time to save them.
TEXT.Spanish: A local species of silkworm has nearly gone extinct. There is still time to save them.

TEXT.English: If we start a new breeding program, we will be able to save them.
TEXT.French: Si nous démarrons un programme de réintroduction, nous pourrons les sauver.
TEXT.German: Wenn wir ein neues Zuchtprogramm starten können wir sie noch retten.
TEXT.Italian: If we start a new breeding program, we will be able to save them.
TEXT.Spanish: If we start a new breeding program, we will be able to save them.

TEXT.English: The treasury is for serious purposes, not for "conservation"!
TEXT.French: Le trésor doit être utilisé pour des projets sérieux, par pour de la "conservation"!
TEXT.German: Unsere Finanzen werden für ernsthafte Dinge benützt, nicht für "Umweltschitz"!
TEXT.Italian: The treasury is for serious purposes, not for "conservation"!
TEXT.Spanish: The treasury is for serious purposes, not for "conservation"!

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective citizens have adopted a marching song as their new national anthem.
TEXT.French: Des Citoyens %s1:3_civ_adjective ont adopté un chant à la mode comme hymne national.
TEXT.German: %s1_civ_adjective Bürger haben ein Marschlied zur neuen Nationalhymne erklärt.
TEXT.Italian: %s1_civ_adjective citizens have adopted a marching song as their new national anthem.
TEXT.Spanish: %s1_civ_adjective citizens have adopted a marching song as their new national anthem.

TEXT.English: Our citizens have adopted one of our army's marching songs as the official national anthem!
TEXT.French: Nos citoyens ont adopté une de nos chant de guerre comme hymne national!
TEXT.German: Unsere Bürger haben ein Marschlied unserer Armee zur offiziellen Nationalhymne erklärt!
TEXT.Italian: Our citizens have adopted one of our army's marching songs as the official national anthem!
TEXT.Spanish: Our citizens have adopted one of our army's marching songs as the official national anthem!

TEXT.English: It'll make the people happy.
TEXT.French: Cela va réjouir le peuple.
TEXT.German: Es wird die Leute glücklich machen.
TEXT.Italian: It'll make the people happy.
TEXT.Spanish: It'll make the people happy.

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective senators stand accused of excessive patronage.
TEXT.French: Des Sénateurs %s1:3_civ_adjective ont été accusé de prise illégale d'intérêts.
TEXT.German: Den %s1_civ_adjective Senatoren wird überzogene Klientelwirtschaft vorgeworfen.
TEXT.Italian: A local species of silkworm in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire is almost extinct.
TEXT.Spanish: A local species of silkworm in the %s1_civ_adjective Empire is almost extinct.

TEXT.English: Several high-ranking senators have been accused of corruption and excessive patronage.
TEXT.French: Plusieurs sénateurs de haut rang ont été accusé de corruption et de prise d'intérêts.
TEXT.German: Einigen hochrangigen Senatoren wird Korruption und überzogene Klientelwirtschaft vorgeworfen.
TEXT.Italian: Several high-ranking senators have been accused of corruption and excessive patronage.
TEXT.Spanish: Several high-ranking senators have been accused of corruption and excessive patronage.

TEXT.English: We'll just have to deal with the public's outrage.
TEXT.French: Il va falloir faire face à la colère du public.
TEXT.German: Wir werden mit der öffentlichen Verärgerung zurechtkommen müssen.
TEXT.Italian: We'll just have to deal with the public's outrage.
TEXT.Spanish: We'll just have to deal with the public's outrage.

TEXT.English: We should be able to bribe a few of the opposition leaders to take care of this.
TEXT.French: Nous devrions pouvoir corrompre quelques leaders de l'opposition pour étouffer l'affaire.
TEXT.German: Wir sollten in der Lage sein, ein paar oppositionelle Anführer zu bestechen und sich darum zu kümmern.
TEXT.Italian: We should be able to bribe a few of the opposition leaders to take care of this.
TEXT.Spanish: We should be able to bribe a few of the opposition leaders to take care of this.

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective naval units have been equipped with new anti-aircraft guns.
TEXT.French: Des Unités navales %s1:4_civ_adjective ont été équipées de nouveaux canons anti-aériens.
TEXT.German: %s1_civ_adjective Marineeinheiten wurden mit neuartigen Flugabwehrwaffen ausgerüstet.
TEXT.Italian: %s1_civ_adjective naval units have been equipped with new anti-aircraft guns.
TEXT.Spanish: %s1_civ_adjective naval units have been equipped with new anti-aircraft guns.

TEXT.English: Our naval units have been equipped with new anti-aircraft guns.
TEXT.French: Nos unités navales ont été équipées de nouveaux canons anti-aériens.
TEXT.German: Unsere Marineeinheiten wurden mit neuartigen Flugabwehrwaffen ausgerüstet.
TEXT.Italian: Our naval units have been equipped with new anti-aircraft guns.
TEXT.Spanish: Our naval units have been equipped with new anti-aircraft guns.

TEXT.English: Great! Shoot 'm all out of the sky!
TEXT.French: Super! Descendez-les tous en vol!
TEXT.German: Großartig! Schießt sie alle vom Himmel!
TEXT.Italian: Great! Shoot 'm all out of the sky!
TEXT.Spanish: Great! Shoot 'm all out of the sky!
